Saying someone is trolling is one thing. Constantly blaming the game on them, reminding everyone they're trolling, telling them to stop talking, and telling them their life is sad is way too far in the direction of insults, belittling comments, and inappropriate levels of ally blaming.

i do see what your saying there! Does everyone forget there is a mute button! why cant i shut chat off? and isnt this game for "adults"? life is going to destroy these people that report over them trolling!!! 100% came in stole first jg camp and  then inted it to the other team!

> [{quoted}](name=TheFingerpointer,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EWTtc3O0,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-05-02T15:48:45.154+0000)
>
> i do see what your saying there! Does everyone forget there is a mute button! why cant i shut chat off? and isnt this game for "adults"? life is going to destroy these people that report over them trolling!!! 100% came in stole first jg camp and  then inted it to the other team!

This is a game for adults and children both. Regardless of whether you are an adult or a child, however, you will find that many businesses and social situations do not allow you to rant and blame other people without being asked to either change your behavior or leave. If you start consistently insulting someone at a movie theater, for example, they will not simply tell that person to put on earphones, because it is not that person's responsibility to find a way to avoid you're prohibited behavior.

In short, the mute button is a defense against toxicity, but it does not exist as an excuse to allow it merely because there is a way to avoid it. I understand that having someone on your team who is intentionally feeding is an infuriating and frustrating experience, but that does not justify the sort of response you showed to the situation.

The adult argument is not an especially good one, but if you seek to use it then I would recommend trying to be the adult in the room in that sort of situation, and handling your frustration gracefully without resorting to blaming or belittling or insulting other players.
You spent the whole game flaming multiple people uncontrollably from the start. Be glad it was just a restriction.
clearly u have no idea what your talking about! the "flame" is saying report 1 person and talking very nice to everyone els lol
please talk chat out of the game! calling a guy a troll after he inted all game ishardly "flame"
It's still flame. It's flame whether you direct it at a heavenly nice individual or the worst of the worst players in League. Who it's directed at doesn't make it any more or less acceptable.

>  calling a guy a troll after he inted all game ishardly "flame"

I have surprising news for you.. You thinking they are a troll actually does not allow you to break the rules, it just makes you as bad as them - probably worse, since with your reactionary, angry attitude i doubt they actually trolled at all.
you sir are a pre-madonna snoflake!

*Prima donna, not pre-Madonna, although that's an easy confusion until you see it correctly the first time. It's also *snowflake, not snoflake, I know spell check can mess you up sometimes, but it honestly helps way more than it hurts. And terrible punctuation, although you *did* use end punctuation, which is more than some.

And, of course, insulting someone does not help your cause at all. Not even a tiny bit.

> pre-madonna

[I do not think it means what you think it means..](http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/you-keep-using-that-word-i-do-not-think-it-means-what-you-think-it-means)

You posted the log, it shows you doing nothing but flaming all game.

Reality is not subjective.
1 person! the varus that inted and was toxic! who els in that game? please tell me

Someone else doing something _you_ think is wrong does not give you a free pass to _also_ int and be toxic. All you did is tilt yourself, annoy everyone else and probably make them play even worse.

If you cant let the system do the judging, the system typically judges you as well. Hopefully both of you are enjoying your restrictions.

You're mildly flaming and you're kind of harassing your teammates. You got a chat restriction, which is the slap on the wrist. Riot wants you to remember that communication is about creating teamwork and cooperation, not insulting teammates and creating toxicity.
